summary: i'm looking for sansa meta. i heard asoiafuniversity is good. any other recs?
question: i'm looking for sansa meta. i heard asoiafuniversity is good. any other recs?
answer:
first of all don’t go to @|asoiafuniversity that place is full to trashy sansa meta written by people who hate her. 0/10 i do not recommend. instead i rec @infinitestalia @trinuviel @turtle-paced @dhaarunispeaks @wendynerdwrites @poorquentyn 

i can’t think of anything else

summary: Hey 🦋! I love your metas! I could read them the whole day! I was reading some of Alayne and i have a Q, why would Harry accept a...
question: Hey 🦋! I love your metas! I could read them the whole day! I was reading some of Alayne and i have a Q, why would Harry accept a marriage with a bastard girl? Do they know her true identity? Thank you, have a lovely day!
answer: Because Littlefinger bought up all the debts of Anya Waynwood, Harry’s guardian, basically forcing her to accept his betrothal offer and staggeringly rich dowry for his bastard daughter Alayne. More details here, hope that helps, and thanks so much!

reblog.comment: Because Littlefinger bought up all the debts of Anya Waynwood, Harry’s guardian, basically forcing her to accept his betrothal offer and staggeringly rich dowry for his bastard daughter Alayne. More details here, hope that helps, and thanks so much!

summary: Sansa Stark Week: DAY FOUR → Politics or Lady of Winterfell/Alayne Stone Coming up, Mya had warned her to keep her eyes on the...
caption:
Sansa Stark Week: DAY FOUR → Politics or Lady of Winterfell/Alayne Stone

Coming up, Mya had warned her to keep her eyes on the path ahead, she remembered. “Look up, not down,” she said… but that was not possible on the descent. I could close my eyes. The mule knows the way, he has no need of me. But that seemed more something Sansa would have done, that frightened girl. Alayne was an older woman, and bastard b r a v e.

tags: i had to wait til i got home to make this
i love this dress so much
they don't show it off enough
summary: SANSA WEEK - Day three: Fashion (Season 3 Wedding Gown) For Sansa’s wedding dress the designer Michele Clapton wanted to have an...
caption:
SANSA WEEK - Day three: Fashion (Season 3 Wedding Gown)

For Sansa’s wedding dress the designer Michele Clapton wanted to have an embroidered band that wrapped around which symbolistically told Sansa’s life from the Tully and Stark beginnings to the entanglement with the Lannisters.  Her story starts at her lower back where the Tully fish and Stark Direwolf entwine. As we move round to the front, the Lannister Lion is becoming dominant over the Direwolf and at the back neck, the Lion’s head is stamped onto Sansa. The dress colour was still very much Sansa Stark and the embroidery had pale golden tones but woven through the story are ripe red pomegranates, the red colour symbolising the growing Lannister influence over her.

tags: the hound and the little bird
summary: So the other day I reblogged art from the CMON ASOIAF miniatures game, and I got curious and wondered if I could buy a Sandor...
caption:
So the other day I reblogged art from the CMON ASOIAF miniatures game, and I got curious and wondered if I could buy a Sandor mini yet. So I check the site – nope, only in a box of other Lannister figures, and that’s sold out. So I check ebay – and aha! someone has broken up the game and is selling all the figures and things individually. And not only did he have a Sandor, but Sansa too, eee. :)

And now I have them, and they’re perfect – so nicely detailed and book-accurate, if very very tiny. Not sure if I’m going to paint them, I’ve never worked with miniatures before and I’m afraid of messing up, but I may give it a shot eventually. For now they’ll just sit on the shelf with my other sansan merchandise…

summary:
🍁

Sansa Week 

 🍁

: 

DAY FOUR: Politics |  the North remembers “...Now many say that house Stark is dead and gone, and house...
caption:
🍁 Sansa Week 🍁 : DAY FOUR: Politics |  the North remembers

“…Now many say that house Stark is dead and gone, and house Bolton holds the North .But the North remembers who united it, the North remembers who defended it and the North remembers who stole it. Long ago my ancestors spared the Boltons, trusting their oaths of fealty .I shall correct that mistake. Even the north can forget when there’s nothing left to remember”

Sansa Stark in the Game of Thrones Histories and Lore - Northern Allegiances to House Stark
